attributes.action: Release to public all photos by the No 10 photographer since 01/20 til now.
attributes.additional_details: For the integrity of our democracy it is vital that we trust our politicians and have full transparency of their actions that are in the national interest. The release of the photos will help the public ascertain the truthfulness of the Prime minister's claim that he did not realise he was attending parties. These photographs have been taken by a tax payer funded photographer and we have a right to see what we have paid for.
attributes.background: I was refused a FOI request from the cabinet for these photos and I believe that in a democracy that is unacceptable. There is no national security issues here merely awkward, embarrassing issues. Through a humble address motion the immediate release of these photos should occur

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions that are effectively freedom of information requests.

If you are unhappy about the outcome of an FOI request you can find out about the appeals process here: https://ico.org.uk/for-organisations/guide-to-freedom-of-information/complaints/
